name: Mister Holdout

topics.response_text: Hey, there, friend, a bit of advice - you look like you could use some *protection.*{Beat, downnote, conspiratiorial}Lucky for you, I got what you need.{Moseys on up}
Things guards can't spot when they're patting you down or checking for iron at your hip.

topics.topic_text: Why would I need to hide a weapon on me?
topics.response_text: Simple - you can't bring guns into the casino, that's why. They'll strip you to your fists.
Take a look at these beauties.

topics.topic_text: Not interested. Maybe some other time.
topics.response_text: {Once only, good bye, "fuck off," shrugs}Suit yourself, it's not my fault if they find your body dumped in Freeside.

topics.topic_text: I can get weapons past the guards, no problem.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED]{Sizing the player up, nods}You might - one fellow I knew was able to slip a pistol past the guards. You?{Sizes up, impressed}I'm guessing you could get a machine gun by them.

topics.topic_text: Hmmm... think I could I slip bigger weapons past the guards?
topics.response_text: [FAILED]{Dubious}An experienced smuggler could get a machine gun or pistol in - you? You're welcome to try.

description:
Mister Holdout is a 45 year-old Caucasian Male.

Mister Holdout is a shifty weapons dealer who specializes in selling small, concealable weapons to those looking to bypass the strict security measures of New Vegas casinos. Operating from a shadowed corner outside the Gomorrah, he bills his wares as 'insurance' - a necessary precaution for those who want to protect themselves in a city where weapons are forbidden. His eyes constantly dart around, alert for authorities or potential competition.

Mister Holdout's Personality: Cautious, opportunistic, and business-minded. Mister Holdout is always looking for the next profitable deal while staying just on the right side of the law. He's friendly enough to potential customers but maintains a suspicious nature, never fully trusting anyone in the dangerous environment of the Mojave Wasteland.

Mister Holdout's Backstory: Before becoming a weapons dealer on the Strip, Mister Holdout was a gambler himself, losing most of his savings at the casinos. Realizing the demand for concealed weapons among desperate gamblers and security-conscious patrons, he turned to selling holdout weapons. He started small but has built a modest reputation over the years for providing reliable, if not always legal, merchandise. His knowledge of the Strip's security systems and personnel has kept him from being caught, making him a valuable source for those looking to circumvent the casinos' strict no-weapons policy.
